lines.text: You pilots are such... men.
They don't call it the cockpit for nothing, honey.
Last night I woke up in a cold sweat, I dreamt I was being chased by a giant banana.
You want to hang me without any explanation.
You hung yourself.

[to Gretchen]
You're like a fine wine, you get better with age, and you're gonna make those Russians drunk.
I want to show the whole world that you don't need to be 15 and have the figure of boy to win a gold medal.
Gee, I remember this Eurasian gal. She had these great big blue eyes. They called her the tarantula. You ever run into her?
No, I don't think so.
You'd remember if you did. She was a real ball breaker!

She's his fourth wife. He always was a horny bastard. There's this story that back in the 20's when he was barnstorming he made a bet that he could put it to this good lookin' wing walker. He boffed her right out on the wing a thousand miles above El Paso. His ass got so sunburned he couldn't sit down a week!

[to Isabelle]
Wait a minute! That perfume of yours smells awfully familiar.
[Patroni gives a funny look to Metrand. He and Isabelle are surprised that Patroni figures out they are involved]

[to Metrand; angry tone]
Je te remercie! On peut avoir confiance en toi!
Thanks a lot! You can have confidence in you!]
What did she say?
Probably the same as you say in English.
I've flown just about every type of aircraft through three wars and forty pounds. Only thing I'm afraid of is heights. Are you afraid of anything, Metrand?
American pilots.

Goddamnn! He fired one! Missiles at five o'clock! Those missiles have a narrow seeking angle, no more than thirty degrees. If we make enough violent maneuvers we may be able to cause a fly-by. Son of a bitch!
I'd love to see what my horoscope said this morning.

[pulls Eli up out of a tear]
Eli, you okay?
I had the best seat in the house!
